content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Because it meets all the criteria and it is working great.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: why you use the caret symbol in your solution? "255 - value" does the same.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: I think this would make a fun code golf problem.

Goal
* Please explain what you mean by inverting a color / how a player should invert a color.

Input
* Please format "r", "g" and "b" as [[variables]].

* Please fix the typo: seperated => separated.

* Please change "value" to "values".

Output
* Please fix the typo: sperated => separated.

* Please change "value" to "values".

Constraints
* Please format the variables properly:
[[r]], [[g]], [[b]] instead of [[r],[g],[b]]

Game modes
* Is Reverse mode really doable?

Stub generator
* Line 1: Please change to:
read r:int g:int b:int

* Please add a write statement, e.g. "write answer".

Cases
* Please change one of the 128 128 128 cases to 127 127 127.

Thanks.

Thanks for your reply, I wasn't that much into the specific syntax so this really helped!
I've changed it as you've suggested. 
What's your concern about reverse mode? I do think with a few examples it's quite doable to guess whats going and and feel like there are way more complicated reverse challenges online.

Hey Manuel, thanks for your reply!

Lol, I didn't even think of it but now that you've said it, it seems pretty obvious to me. Thought of the values as bytes and chose the bitwise approach. That being said, you're totally right, a simple substraction comes to the same result and is more clear.
Anyways, as this won't affect participants I'll leave it like it is for now.

I myself know nothing about colour inversion, but yeah, I should be able to guess the requirement based on the visible tests. 

One point is missing:

Stub generator
* Please add a write statement, e.g. "write answer".

Thanks.
Thank you, I've applied your suggestion.
